This bug is being bounced around because the stack trace for the actual
NullPointerException is missing. The exception above is thrown by SWT when an
async runnable fails, but the stack for the actual failure is missing.  We'll
have to close this unless more information or a test case can be provided. All
we know right now is that some asyncExec threw an NPE.

Closing. The stack trace for the actual NPE is missing so we have way to figure
out where this was coming from.
